p: Over 1300 MERS cases, or almost 80% of global incidence, have been reported from Saudi Arabia [ 1]. Korea has the second highest number of cases (n = 185) and United Arab Emirates (UAE) with 83 cases is third [ 1]. In the past three years since discovery of MERS-CoV, eight major healthcare associated outbreaks have been reported worldwide; the ninth wave recently occurring in multiple cities of Saudi Arabia. Those described here are based on cases with documented nosocomial transmission and are indicated by blue colored clusters in Fig. 5. Cases of MERS patients traveling internationally are indicated by arrows representing the direction of their travel and probable zoonotic transmission cases are marked by brown camels in the same figure.
